description.narrative: The proposed intervention will contribute to the reduction of HIV infections, uptake of HIV testing and other non-communicable diseases in the public sector and also will contribute to improve the capacity of national authorities to deal with issues related to stigma and discrimination by supporting capacity building to the Ministry of Labour and the Ministry of Justice. The expected changes of the proposed interventions are: Operational plan of public sector implemented (home affairs, education, 1 more) to increase the access of workers to testing, treatment and reduce stigma and discrimination in the workplace; and judges and labour inspectors provided with tools to monitor and supervise the implementation of the legal framework and advocate for promotion of gender rights at the workplace

participating-org.narrative: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 7.4. Increased capacity of constituents to provide adequate labour protection to workers in diverse forms of work arrangements, including on digital labour platforms, and in informal employment

transaction.ref: MOZ/18/50/UNA-2019-MOZ128 - Improved implementation of Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work through protection of workers from unacceptable forms of work

provider-org.narrative: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS
